programme.desc: In Swansea, first to host are Ash and Suj from modern Indian restaurant Adelinas. Second hosts, Matthew and Nathan, aim to give their guests a truly Welsh experience at The Dillwyn Arms. The final night is at Jas and Britts Juniper Place.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Nikki and Gordon are on the hunt for a holiday home with great views on the island of Gozo. Ben Hillman shows them what their £350k can buy, but are any the Mediterranean dream?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Retired vicar Annie is swapping her life the UK for the all-year-round sunshine and warmth of glorious Lanzarote. Can Lee Juggurnauth find her the perfect place for her £150k budget?

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Frasier plans a major Christmas blowout, Daphne comes to grips with some surprising information, and Niles new relationship hits a snag.

programme.sub-title: Group E: Burkina Faso v Equatorial Guinea
programme.desc: Burkina Faso will be eyeing at least second spot in this group. Will Equatorial Guineas recent player strike affect the result here?

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A scheming Frasier finally works his way into hosting the annual televised Christmas parade but is horrified to learn that his wildly successful protege - the sassy, brassy radio host Dr Mary - will be his co-host, prompting a battle royal for control of the microphone.

programme.title: Africa Cup of Nations LIVE
programme.desc: Live coverage from the Africa Cup of Nations, a biannual football tournament for African nations.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon OBrien head to the Isle of Wight, where they meet Helen and husband Dave to restore unwanted items including a metal garden bench and an old water feature.

programme.title: In Old California
programme.desc: Tom Craig is a mild-mannered druggist from Boston who opens a shop in wild and woolly Sacramento shortly before the Gold Rush. The town is `owned by the Dawson brothers, Britt and Joe, who poison Craigs tonic when saloon hostess Lacey Miller takes too much of an interest in the handsome newcomer. Town drunk Whitey has one drink too many, and all of Sacramento is soon in a lynching mood.

programme.title: The Alamo
programme.desc: Star-studded saga of the 1836 defence of the Alamo, when a 187-strong garrison including William Travis and Jim Bowie fought to save Texas from Santa Annas Mexican army for 13 days. The rivalry of the two leaders was tempered by the arrival of Davy Crockett, who brought his Tennessee volunteers to fight alongside them.

programme.title: Chisum
programme.desc: A rugged cattle baron takes on an unscrupulous entrepreneur who is determined to subdue the people of Pecos, New Mexico, and take over the cattlemans land. Loosely based on true accounts of bloody territorial conflicts in the late 19th century, the story brings a number of legendary figures from western history into the action, including Billy the Kid and Pat Garrett.

programme.title: Miss Potter
programme.desc: Based on the life of early 20th-century author Beatrix Potter, creator of Peter Rabbit. As a young woman Potter rails against her parents wishes for her to marry and settle down. Her early attempts to find a publisher for her childrens stories are unsuccessful, but an offer from a small firm will turn her into a literary phenomenon.

programme.title: The Interview
programme.sub-title: Celebrities: Anthony Hopkins - A Career in Character
programme.desc: In his own words, Sir Anthony Hopkins describes how a deeply troubled boy from Port Talbot, Wales, achieved two-time Oscar glory in Hollywood. Deemed a failure by his parents, peers and teachers, Sir Anthony Hopkins has triumphed in memorable roles like Hannibal Lecter, King Lear and the Pope. His extraordinary journey was paved with pain, rejection and addiction but was ultimately saved by love.

programme.title: Gladiators
programme.desc: Bradley and Barney Walsh host this special edition of the iconic series, which sees celebrities Joe Wicks, Sam Thompson, Nicola Adams and Vogue Williams take on the Gladiators.

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun is a sheep who lives with his flock in the farmyard, at Mossy Bottom Farm. Shaun and his flock often cause issues for sheepdog Blitzer, who must try and keep them out of trouble.

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Lou Sanders, Martine McCutcheon, David ODoherty, Ade Adepitan, Ross King, Jess Wright, Eddie Kadi and Blu Hydrangea compete to be the strongest link and win up to £50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing returns to the ballroom this Christmas, ready to captivate the nation with a celebration of dance and festive cheer. Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman host as six celebrities step into the spotlight, each hoping to impress the judges and become Christmas Champion 2025. Boy band Blue will deliver a special musical performance, and the Christmas cast take to the floor for two spectacular group dances.

programme.title: Michael McIntyres The Wheel
programme.desc: In this tinsel-covered episode, the celebrity experts are Gyles Brandreth, Josie Gibson, Big Narstie, Tim Vine, Zara McDermott, Nitro, Matthew Horne and Joanna Page.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A situation escalates at The Vic for the Slaters, and the Beales and the Brannings prepare to sit down to a joint family Christmas dinner.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Senior members of Nonnatus House travel to Hong Kong to tackle a crisis at the orders branch house, and Dr Turner and Shelagh search for Mays birth mother.

programme.title: Amandaland
programme.desc: Amanda and the family head to Aunt Joans country house, but the plans change when Mal and Anne tag along, and she struggles to recreate the magical Christmases she spent there as a child. Anne is in despair at being separated from her family, and Felicity is increasingly irritated by her sisters constant high spirits. Meanwhile, Mal sees a hidden photo that seems to reveal a deep family secret.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The Mitchells help make Nigels Christmas extra special.

programme.title: Mrs Browns Boys
programme.desc: Mrs Brown rediscovers the meaning of family as she gathers those closest to her together for a Christmas photo. Buster unveils another of his signature Christmas trees with maximum impact, and Cathy frets about what presents to buy everyone.

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina plans her first Christmas with the family. This break in tradition causes Patsy to experience serious trauma, with the arrival of her sister Jackie pushing Pats closer to the edge.

programme.title: When Harry Met Sally...
programme.desc: Rob Reiners portrait of a couple whose growing attraction toward each other threatens to disrupt their friendship.

programme.desc: The three teams joining Marvin and Rochelle Humes to test their music knowledge for this festive treat are presenter Arielle Free and music legend Paul Young, `Mrs Browns Boys stars Fiona OCarroll and Eilish OCarroll, and DJs Gary Davies and Richie Anderson.

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Lou Sanders, Martine McCutcheon, David ODoherty, Ade Adepitan, Ross King, Jess Wright, Eddie Kadi and Blu Hydrangea compete to be the strongest link and win up to £50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing returns to the ballroom this Christmas, ready to captivate the nation with a celebration of dance and festive cheer. Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman host as six celebrities step into the spotlight, each hoping to impress the judges and become Christmas Champion 2025. Boy band Blue will deliver a special musical performance, and the Christmas cast take to the floor for two spectacular group dances.

programme.title: Michael McIntyres The Wheel
programme.desc: In this tinsel-covered episode, the celebrity experts are Gyles Brandreth, Josie Gibson, Big Narstie, Tim Vine, Zara McDermott, Nitro, Matthew Horne and Joanna Page.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A situation escalates at The Vic for the Slaters, and the Beales and the Brannings prepare to sit down to a joint family Christmas dinner.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Senior members of Nonnatus House travel to Hong Kong to tackle a crisis at the orders branch house, and Dr Turner and Shelagh search for Mays birth mother.

programme.title: Amandaland
programme.desc: Amanda and the family head to Aunt Joans country house, but the plans change when Mal and Anne tag along, and she struggles to recreate the magical Christmases she spent there as a child. Anne is in despair at being separated from her family, and Felicity is increasingly irritated by her sisters constant high spirits. Meanwhile, Mal sees a hidden photo that seems to reveal a deep family secret.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The Mitchells help make Nigels Christmas extra special.

programme.title: Mrs Browns Boys
programme.desc: Mrs Brown rediscovers the meaning of family as she gathers those closest to her together for a Christmas photo. Buster unveils another of his signature Christmas trees with maximum impact, and Cathy frets about what presents to buy everyone.

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina plans her first Christmas with the family. This break in tradition causes Patsy to experience serious trauma, with the arrival of her sister Jackie pushing Pats closer to the edge.

programme.title: When Harry Met Sally...
programme.desc: Rob Reiners portrait of a couple whose growing attraction toward each other threatens to disrupt their friendship.

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: The three teams joining Marvin and Rochelle Humes to test their music knowledge for this festive treat are presenter Arielle Free and music legend Paul Young, `Mrs Browns Boys stars Fiona OCarroll and Eilish OCarroll, and DJs Gary Davies and Richie Anderson.

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: Detailed weather forecast.

programme.title: Newsday
programme.desc: From London and Singapore the latest international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Review
programme.desc: BBC News remembers some of those who have left us this year.

programme.title: Joins BBC News
programme.desc: BBC Parliament joins the BBCs rolling news channel.

programme.title: Reporting Scotland
programme.desc: The latest news and weather from around Scotland.

programme.title: Snow Dogs
programme.desc: Wildlife film-maker Gordon Buchanan gets close to seven incredible huskies on a treacherous dogsled adventure through Canadas spectacular Yukon wilderness, gaining a new appreciation for dogs and our place in nature.

programme.title: City Lights
programme.desc: Bank clerk Willie Melvin is convinced he could be a best-selling author. He has the ambition, the determination and the typewriter; all he needs is the talent, a point he has overlooked.

programme.title: City Lights
programme.desc: A nostalgic look back at `City Lights, the iconic sitcom that captured the spirit of 1980s Scotland. Surviving cast members Elaine C Smith, Jonathan Watson, Dave Anderson and the shows creator, Bob Black look back at the series magical moments.

programme.title: River City
programme.desc: The community processes the aftermath of the gruesome discovery, which manifests in panic for some. Amber is stunned when Lennys interference gives her more than she bargained for, Alex acts on his growing suspicions of Viv.

programme.title: A Christmas Choir with Michelle McManus
programme.desc: Michelle McManus is joined by two wonderful choirs to celebrate the season with a sackful of Christmas songs.

programme.title: Breaking the News
programme.desc: Des Clarke is joined by Elaine Malcolmson, Mark Nelson, Jay Lafferty and Stuart Mitchell to take a look back at the biggest stories of the last decade.

programme.title: This is BBC Scotland
programme.desc: Launches Sunday 24 February at 7pm with comedy, drama, documentaries, news and sport.

programme.title: This is BBC Scotland
programme.desc: Launches Sunday 24 February at 7pm with comedy, drama, documentaries, news and sport.

programme.title: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: Fastidious businessman Neal Page and slobbish shower-curtain salesman Del Griffith are the reluctant odd couple trying to get home from New York to Chicago to be with their families at Thanksgiving whose thwarted travel plans keep throwing them together in.

programme.title: Him and Her
programme.desc: Its Christmas Day in Steve and Beckys flat and Steves got a surprise visitor.

programme.title: This Is BBC THREE
programme.desc: BBC THREE: Refreshing TV for the digital age. Tune in daily from 7.00pm.

programme.title: This Is BBC THREE
programme.desc: BBC THREE: Refreshing TV for the digital age. Tune in daily from 7.00pm.

programme.title: The Catch-Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news.

programme.title: Nativity!
programme.desc: A primary school teacher, who was once a failed actor in a former career, is given the task of directing the schools Nativity play, which doesnt have a positive track record. Attitudes change however, when it transpires that a Hollywood producer is coming to film the play.

programme.title: Spider-Man: Far From Home
programme.desc: Spider-Man teams up with Nick Fury and fellow superhero Mysterio to stop four massive elemental creatures -- each representing Earth, air, water and fire -- from wreaking havoc across Europe.

programme.title: Spider-Man: No Way Home
programme.desc: Spider-Mans identity is revealed to everyone, and he can no longer separate his normal life from his superhero life. When he asks Doctor Strange for help, it forces him to discover what it means to be him.

programme.title: Mrs Browns Boys
programme.desc: Its Christmas in Finglas once again. Agnes has been recruited to the church choir, but shes under strict instructions from Father McBride that theres to be no singing and certainly no dancing. Thats not the only thing off-limits: a Christmas tree shortage means Buster has to get even more creative than usual to impress Agnes. Meanwhile, Dermot and Buster have organised this years festivities at Foleys and are holding a murder mystery night in aid of alcoholic greyhounds.

programme.title: Mrs Browns Boys
programme.desc: Its Christmas in Finglas again, and Agnes is failing to convince the gang shes not grumpy. Meanwhile, Cathy pulls the Finglas community together in support of a festive good cause, and Buster sources a sustainable tree.

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Nessa and the Wests head east, with some help from Dave and his coach. Meanwhile in Essex, Dawn and Pete visit for drinks, Mick is preoccupied with his new love, and Smithy cannot wait to spend his first Christmas with Neil the Baby. Pam has prepared a lovely spread and Bryn has his mistletoe ready, but as the Christmas spirit gets a grip, Gavin and Stacey have a startling announcement to make.

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Its been ten years since we last went to Billericay to spend Christmas with the Shipmans and the Wests.This year were off to Wales for the festivities, where Bryns cooking dinner for over thirteen people.

programme.title: This Is BBC THREE
programme.desc: BBC THREE: Refreshing TV for the digital age. Tune in daily from 7.00pm.

programme.title: This Is BBC THREE
programme.desc: BBC THREE: Refreshing TV for the digital age. Tune in daily from 7.00pm.

programme.title: Wallace and Gromit: Vengeance Most Fowl
programme.desc: Wallace invents a smart gnome that has a mind of its own - or does it? It falls to Gromit to take on the dastardly Feathers McGraw once more... or Wallace may never invent again!

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Christmas fever is in full swing in Walford as the Mitchell family lunch is interrupted by an unexpected visitor. In a flash, Denise, Kathy, Linda, Sharon, Stacey and Sukis lives are changed forever as a Walford male meets his fate in the Vic.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The Beales family are in for a very tense Christmas dinner.

programme.title: Wallace and Gromit: The Wrong Trousers
programme.desc: Wallace and his canine companion become embroiled in a bizarre jewellery heist after a mysterious penguin takes up residence in their house.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: After watching the very explosive video, tensions are definitely running very high.

programme.title: EastEnders: Christmas 1986 - 2007
programme.desc: The Watts Christmas dinner does not go as planned, Ian has unexpected guests, and two people bid farewell to the Square. Also, Zoe, Dennis and Sharon face life-changing decisions.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: With the Mitchells nursing their bitterness in all corners of the Square, Archie finally has the Vic to himself - but one by one his legion of enemies return with murder on their mind. Elsewhere, Bianca has a big question for Ricky and he has an even bigger answer, Stacey has an announcement that will rock Bradleys world, and just when Max thought things couldnt get any worse, they do.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Its Christmas day in Albert Square and things are set to explode in catastrophic style for Max. Meanwhile, Mick and Linda prepare for their vow renewals but Micks day is thrown into turmoil when Aidan plays a very dangerous game.

programme.title: EastEnders: Christmas 1986 - 2007
programme.desc: Ians surprise leaves Laura reeling, while Phil and Sonia try to cope with terrible news. Little Mo receives wedding gifts from the Slater girls. Pauline tries to put Martin in a better mood.

programme.title: EastEnders: Iconic Episodes
programme.desc: Billys nerves almost get the better of him, and Garry has to deal with a revelation. Jamie and Sonia make a vow.

programme.title: A Mary Berry Christmas
programme.desc: Dame Mary Berry celebrates the magic of the seasons traditions. Along with her special guests - legendary actor Alison Steadman, Commonwealth sprinter and star of Gladiators Harry Aikines-Aryeetey and much-loved broadcaster and presenter Zoe Ball. And central to it all are Marys exceptional recipes, including pigs in blankets cassoulet, roast king mushrooms with chestnut stuffing, a magnificent cherry and lemon mille-feuille and a show-stopping grand finale of pear and ginger steamed pudding.

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.sub-title: Christmas Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: The countdown to Christmas is on as the teams at three unique National Trust houses each race against the clock to deck their halls in time for their dazzling festive openings.

programme.title: Sir Chris Hoy: Cycle of Hope
programme.desc: Sir Chris Hoy opens up about his journey with terminal cancer and how the mental strength he honed as a six-time Olympic gold medallist is now helping him to inspire others. Filmed behind the scenes, the celebrated cyclist and his family share their experience of his cancer diagnosis in 2024. This emotive programme follows Hoy as he balances life as a husband, father and friend alongside treatment and the charity work hes so passionate about.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Mathew Baynton, Mel Giedroyc, Harriet Kemsley and Charles Venn test their general knowledge skills for a special festive show in Richard Osmans Festive House of Games.

programme.title: Celebrity Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton faces his toughest assignment to date as he attempts to find broadcasting icon Janet Street-Porter a country retreat, away from prying neighbours.

programme.title: Gardeners World
programme.desc: Monty and the team celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings.

programme.title: Citizen Kane
programme.desc: Frequently voted one of the best films ever made, Orson Welless masterpiece tells the story of newspaper magnate Charles Foster Kane in a series of flashbacks. A reporter is intrigued by the dying Kanes last word - rosebud - and sets out to find a new angle on the life of one of the most powerful men in America. Nine Oscar nominations resulted in only one award for the outspoken Welles - Best Screenplay.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel is in Beeston, Nottinghamshire, to see a four-bed mid-terrace that the new owners have grand plans to turn into an HMO. Martin is in Welwyn Garden City, Hertfordshire, to see a three-bed end-terrace in need of a new lease of life. Jacqui is in Brighton visiting a rather grand Victorian terrace with five bedrooms over four floors.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Its the most wonderful time of the year... for bargain hunting! Eric Knowles and Father Christmas host an action-packed Christmas programme from Newark in Nottinghamshire. On the teams Christmas lists are profits aplenty, as they dash around stalls bursting with antiques and collectibles. Theyll be helped by two Christmas crackers, Raj Bisram and Izzie Balmer, as they gift their expert knowledge to the teams.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman heads to the counties of Shropshire and Herefordshire to help a recently retired couple with a £550,000 budget find a dream country home thats full of traditional period charm. Away from the property search, Nicki meets enthusiasts who reach for the sky when she visits the Weston Park Model Air Show.

programme.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
programme.desc: A young woman eagerly awaits the St Louis Exposition as much as love with the boy next door, only for her father to threaten to uproot them to New York, where promotion beckons.

programme.title: Doris Day: I Dont Even Like Apple Pie
programme.desc: In a rare television interview, Doris Day looks back over her successful acting and singing career, and recalls happy memories of working with Rock Hudson, James Cagney, Clark Gable and James Garner.

programme.title: Calamity Jane
programme.desc: Indian scout Calamity Jane is as handy with a gun as any man in Deadwood, Dakota Territory. When sent to Chicago to recruit an actress for the Golden Garter stage, the woman proves to be a more feminine rival for the attentions of Janes male friends, including Wild Bill Hickok.

programme.title: Carols from Kings
programme.desc: A celebration of Christmas from the stunning, candlelit Kings College Chapel, Cambridge, beginning in the time-honoured way as a solo chorister sings the first verse of Once in Royal Davids City.

programme.title: The Room in the Tower: A Ghost Story for Christmas

programme.title: The Duchess

programme.title: Talking Pictures

programme.title: The Nutcracker from the Royal Ballet
programme.desc: Christmas comes to life in this magical production from ballet legend Sir Peter Wright, delighting a packed audience at Covent Gardens Royal Opera House.

programme.title: White Christmas
programme.desc: Two army buddies who have become entertainers travel to a Vermont ski resort for a well-earned rest. However, on arrival they find the resort - run by their old army commander - in need of a helping hand. Theres only one answer - put on a show.

programme.title: The King
programme.desc: HM King Charles III delivers his annual Christmas message to the nation and the Commonwealth.

programme.title: Evil Under the Sun
programme.desc: Hercule Poirot sets out to uncover the truth behind the death of an unpopular stage star at a resort hotel on an Adriatic island.

programme.desc: Toby Jones presents a set of must-see Dads Army moments from the BBCs archives, including Mainwaring dancing and sparring with Morecambe and Wise and a special tribute to Noel Coward.

programme.title: Dads Army
programme.desc: Capt Mainwaring has an unexpected and most unwelcome guest, much to the delight of Frazer - his twin brother.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: In this Christmas special Hyacinth is plagued by problems. While busy planning a new kitchen she is told that there is someone in fathers bed who is most certainly not father himself. She then learns that Richard has gone down with a fungus infection, and is horrified to find that he has such a vulgar ailment.

programme.title: The Morecambe and Wise Show
programme.desc: Sketches and stand-up comedy from Eric Morecambe and Ernie Wise from 1968, remarkably restored after being feared lost for decades.

programme.title: The Morecambe and Wise Show
programme.desc: A star-studded holiday special starring Eric Morecambe and Ernie Wise, first broadcast in 1975. With special guests Diana Rigg, Des OConnor, Gordon Jackson, Diane Solomon, Robin Day, Brenda Arnau and Pans People.

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: Scary chiller about a coastal community plagued by a killer shark. With the summer tourist season at hand, the mayor is keen to keep the first attack hushed up. However, when an expert claims that the attacks are the work of a giant great white shark, there is only one solution - to kill the monster fish before it can feed again.

programme.title: Jaws @ 50: The Definitive Inside Story
programme.desc: Interviews, outtakes and never-before-seen footage provide insight into the chaos and creativity behind the making of Steven Spielbergs legendary blockbuster "Jaws."

programme.title: And Now for Something Completely Different
programme.desc: Silly walks and dead parrots are among the items in this compilation of skits from `Monty Pythons Flying Circus. Watch the team unleash the funniest moments from their early days.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Senior members of Nonnatus House travel to Hong Kong to tackle a crisis at the orders branch house, and Dr Turner and Shelagh search for Mays birth mother.

programme.title: A Mary Berry Christmas
programme.desc: Dame Mary Berry celebrates the magic of the seasons traditions. Along with her special guests - legendary actor Alison Steadman, Commonwealth sprinter and star of Gladiators Harry Aikines-Aryeetey and much-loved broadcaster and presenter Zoe Ball. And central to it all are Marys exceptional recipes, including pigs in blankets cassoulet, roast king mushrooms with chestnut stuffing, a magnificent cherry and lemon mille-feuille and a show-stopping grand finale of pear and ginger steamed pudding.

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.sub-title: Christmas Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: The countdown to Christmas is on as the teams at three unique National Trust houses each race against the clock to deck their halls in time for their dazzling festive openings.

programme.title: Sir Chris Hoy: Cycle of Hope
programme.desc: Sir Chris Hoy opens up about his journey with terminal cancer and how the mental strength he honed as a six-time Olympic gold medallist is now helping him to inspire others. Filmed behind the scenes, the celebrated cyclist and his family share their experience of his cancer diagnosis in 2024. This emotive programme follows Hoy as he balances life as a husband, father and friend alongside treatment and the charity work hes so passionate about.

programme.title: Gardeners World
programme.desc: Monty and the team celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings.

programme.title: Citizen Kane
programme.desc: Frequently voted one of the best films ever made, Orson Welless masterpiece tells the story of newspaper magnate Charles Foster Kane in a series of flashbacks. A reporter is intrigued by the dying Kanes last word - rosebud - and sets out to find a new angle on the life of one of the most powerful men in America. Nine Oscar nominations resulted in only one award for the outspoken Welles - Best Screenplay.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel is in Beeston, Nottinghamshire, to see a four-bed mid-terrace that the new owners have grand plans to turn into an HMO. Martin is in Welwyn Garden City, Hertfordshire, to see a three-bed end-terrace in need of a new lease of life. Jacqui is in Brighton visiting a rather grand Victorian terrace with five bedrooms over four floors.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

Theyll be helped by two Christmas crackers, Raj Bisram and Izzie Balmer, as they gift their expert knowledge to the teams.

programme.desc: David and his dealers Michael Hogben, Mark Stevens, Stewart Hofgartner and Corrie Jeffrey are in Blackburn. Items of interest include a Victorian wax seal, a Clarice Cliff jug and an obscure telephone repair kit.

programme.desc: The bidders return to Dallas hoping to land a locker of a lifetime. Mary flouts the law in her eagerness to score a dream unit.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn

programme.title: Holy Marvels With Dennis Quaid
programme.desc: In the Bible, there are two arks, each designed by God himself; both the Ark of the Covenant and Noahs Ark were built to protect, before they were lost to history; researchers have been searching for both for centuries.

programme.title: Holy Marvels With Dennis Quaid
programme.desc: The quest for immortality has captivated and confounded people for thousands of years, from the healing powers of the Holy Grail used by Jesus at the Last Supper, to the elusive Fountain of Youth and the storied philosophers stone.

programme.title: Holy Marvels With Dennis Quaid
programme.desc: Relics from the crucifixion of Jesus Christ have fascinated the faithful for 2000 years--from the wooden cross and iron nails, to the crown of thorns and Spear of Destiny. But do these sacred artefacts still exist? And if so, where are they?

programme.title: Holy Marvels With Dennis Quaid
programme.desc: For millennia, there has been speculation about how the world will end.

programme.title: Holy Marvels With Dennis Quaid
programme.desc: The legendary treasures of the Copper Scroll, King Solomons mines, and the Syamantaka Gem have captivated the world for centuries. But could these vast fortunes still be out there, waiting to be discovered?

programme.title: The Jesus Strand: A Search for DNA
programme.desc: Geneticist George Busby and biblical scholar Pastor Joe Basile study holy relics, including the bones of John the Baptist, hoping to retrieve a sample of DNA that belongs to Jesus or a member of his family.

programme.title: Banned From the Bible
programme.desc: Ancient texts shed new light on the many competing Christian sects that sprang up in the first centuries after Christs crucifixion.

programme.title: God Code
programme.desc: Behind locked doors in St Petersburg, Russia, is the Leningrad Codex, the worlds oldest complete text of the Hebrew Bible. Timothy Smith, an antiquities dealer, believes he has found an intricate code hidden within its text.

programme.title: Junk and Disorderly
programme.desc: In this bumper episode, Henry and Sam visit the biggest classic motorcycle auction and autojumble in the UK, the Stafford Show, with, shall we say, mixed results.

programme.title: Junk and Disorderly
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove scour the country, answering the question on everyones lips - can you make money from auto-jumbles and auctions?

programme.title: Junk and Disorderly

programme.desc: At a mysterious site in the Gobi Desert, experts discover a monster graveyard; the groundbreaking find contains the treasures of the alien beasts that once lived in this strange world.

With the help of her sister, Tilly decorates her biscuits with a beautiful white icing. programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Woodgreen Pets Charity try to find homes for their abandoned dogs in time for Christmas. Ziggy, a fox terrier, hopes she can steal the hearts of the Thompson family. And Emori the three-legged German Shepherd is introduced to retiree Pauline.

programme.title: Terry Pratchetts The Abominable Snow Baby

programme.title: The Snowman
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve and a little boy decides to make a snowman. During the night, the snowman comes to life and whisks the boy off to the North Pole for a meeting with a very important person.

programme.title: Father Christmas
programme.desc: Father Christmas decides its time for a well-earned holiday. Transforming his sleigh into a caravan, Santa sets off on a world trip, but he might have left it too late to prepare for next years Christmas.

programme.title: The Snowman and the Snowdog
programme.desc: The sequel to Raymond Briggss classic `The Snowman. When a young boy, Billy, and his mother move house, he discovers a box hidden under the floorboards of his bedroom.

programme.title: Were Going on a Bear Hunt

programme.title: The Tiger Who Came to Tea
programme.desc: A young girl named Sophie invites an anthropomorphised tiger over for an intimate tea party. He proceeds to drink all the tea and eat all the food.

programme.title: Babe

programme.desc: A cabaret singer witnesses a murder and goes undercover as a nun. In the convent, she is put in charge of coaching the choir, which she transforms into a toe-tapping rhythm group. programme.desc: Ray thinks a family portrait would make a great Christmas present for his parents, until Marie and Debra clash over who counts as family.

programme.desc: When Marie receives a letter from a relative detailing how wonderful her life is, it drives her insane with jealousy and she enlists Debras help in writing a Barone family update.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: An agent offers Joey a movie role as Al Pacinos naked body double, Ross tries to be less conservative, and Chandler thinks his fantasies have come true when he has an affair with a married woman.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: A power cut leaves Chandler stranded in a bank with a gorgeous woman, Ross tries to ask Rachel out on a date, and Joey learns that Monica used to be infatuated with him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Ick Factor
programme.desc: Monica discovers that shes developed a highly mature approach to her latest love affair, and Ross finds out that hes being mistaken for a male prostitute.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey gets a great acting opportunity on `Days of our Lives, Rachel dates a guy called Russ who is amazingly similar to Ross, and Monica renews her relationship with `Fun Bobby, but finds out Bobby is only fun when he is drinking.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One After the Super Bowl
programme.desc: Joey starts dating a fan who is gorgeous, but soon discovers that shes also quite mad. Meanwhile, Ross is reminded how much he misses Marcel his old pet monkey, and travels to San Diego Zoo to find out what has happened to him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Prom Video
programme.desc: When Monicas parents clear out her old room to install a gym, they unearth an old video of her and Rachels first prom night. Its obvious from this that Ross is in love with Rachel and, having told him it will never happen, Rachel changes her mind. Elsewhere, Joey gives Chandler a hideous bracelet as a token of his friendship and is mortally offended to hear Chandler saying how terrible it is.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross and Rachel ... You Know
programme.desc: Among the guests at Monicas party is a handsome and sophisticated doctor, but the only problem is that hes old enough to be her father. Meanwhile, Joey buys a big screen TV and two reclining leather armchairs with the money from his `Days of Our Lives contract.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Chicken Pox
programme.desc: Phoebes submariner boyfriend visits New York on leave from the Navy. Unfortunately, Phoebe catches chicken pox at baby Bens first birthday party. Meanwhile, when Monica realises that Richard has no real neuroses, she worries that she is too strange for him.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Cant Remember Which Sister
programme.desc: Ross is suspicious about Rachels possible job offer from a good-looking stranger, while Chandler cant remember which of Joeys many attractive sisters he kissed at a party.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With All the Jealousy
programme.desc: Ross becomes increasingly jealous of Rachels sexy new colleague, Mark, and gets the wrong end of the stick when he spies on Rachel at her office. Meanwhile, Monica is enamoured with a sexy busboy who writes love poems for her, and Joey gets himself into trouble by faking his CV in order to get a part in a Broadway musical.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Monica and Richard Are Just Friends
programme.desc: Monica bumps into Richard in a video store and they decide to work on their friendship, but the more time they spend together, the more sexual their relationship becomes. Meanwhile, Phoebe dates an athlete who unintentionally keeps exposing himself by wearing loose shorts, and Rachel agrees to read `The Shining if Joey will read `Little Women.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe is reunited with her former singing partner, Leslie, a failed television commercial jingle writer who wants to use Phoebes signature song `Smelly Cat in an advertisement for cat litter. Meanwhile, Ross becomes jealous when Rachel agrees to go to a fashion lecture with Mark, a former colleague who has just left for a new job, and Chandler meets a beautiful woman, Ginger, who has a prosthetic leg.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross tries to prevent Rachel from learning his disturbing secret. Meanwhile, Monica, Phoebe, Chandler and Joey spend a night eavesdropping.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross is dating Rachel again but hates what he had to do to get back together, while Phoebe and her real mother, Phoebe Snr, get to know each other better. Meanwhile, Monica is badly stung by a jellyfish and has to resort to drastic measures to relieve the pain.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.sub-title: The Best Bits of Mr Bean
programme.desc: Loveable buffoon Mr Bean has the unique talent of turning the most ordinary of situations into moments of excruciating embarrassment.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Absurd comedy about a likeable buffoon who turns the most ordinary situations into moments of excruciating embarrassment. Mr Bean rushes to his exam only to find out hes studied the wrong subject. He then goes to the beach but struggles to change into his swimming trunks discretely. Later on, he has difficulty attending a church service without drawing attention to himself.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean wants to give a busker some money until he realises he has no change, while afterwards he goes shopping but gets carried away. Later, he treats himself to a birthday dinner but is disappointed with his dish. Finally, Mr Bean attends a royal film premiere in order to meet the Queen, with disastrous results.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean goes to a swimming pool but finds himself terrified of the high diving board; afterwards, he must try several imaginative ways to get out of the car park when he doesnt have enough money to pay. He then demonstrates the proper way to make a sandwich whilst out at the park. Finally, when Mr Bean and his girlfriend go on a date to watch a horror movie he teases her for being scared, until the film actually starts.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean buys a portable television but cant get it to work properly. Then, when his camera is stolen, he must identify the suspect in a police line up. Afterwards, he attends a magic show and disco with his girlfriend but ends up embarrassing her.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean rushes to the dentists office after oversleeping, then helps a boy fix his remote-controlled toy boat, and later is menaced by a wasp while having a picnic.

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean goes Christmas shopping, conducts a Salvation Army band, and has Christmas dinner with his long-suffering girlfriend.

programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Dates a Student
programme.desc: When a fire damages their apartment, Rachel and Phoebe must choose between living temporarily with Joey or Monica. Meanwhile, Ross gets into trouble at work, and Chandler tries to help Joeys career.

programme.desc: A group of New York tenement dwellers face eviction and receive help from an unlikely source. programme.title: Jumanji
programme.desc: Alan Parrish disappeared as a young boy. Nobody believes his friends story that he was sucked into the game they were playing. programme.desc: As the gang digests Monicas huge Thanksgiving meal, everyone reminisces about their worst Thanksgiving ever.

programme.desc: Joey plots the perfect opportunity to kiss Janine, while Ross and Monica resurrect their silly high school dance routine for a television special.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: During the Christmas holiday, Marge attempts to muster the wherewithal to kick down-on-his-luck Gil out of the Simpson house.

programme.title: The Snowman
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve and a little boy decides to make a snowman. During the night, the snowman comes to life and whisks the boy off to the North Pole for a meeting with a very important person.

programme.title: The Snowman and the Snowdog
programme.desc: The sequel to Raymond Briggss classic `The Snowman. When a young boy, Billy, and his mother move house, he discovers a box hidden under the floorboards of his bedroom.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The nations favourite armchair critics cast their eyes over the years biggest Christmas TV shows, including classic movies, exciting new dramas and some of tellys biggest traditional treats.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Wills parents have just divorced and he has unwillingly had to move area and change schools. He was previously at a private school, so has inherited some snobbish tendencies.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will, Simon, Jay and Neil bunk off from the sixth form. Part one of the master plan has Simon call the school and pretend to be his own mother.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Simon is about to sit his first driving test, and Will, Jay and Neil are very excited by the new possibilities. As soon as Simon has passed they plan to visit Thorpe Park to ride roller coasters and chase girls. There is one problem though.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will finds out that going to a mixed-sex school isnt too bad after all as he pulls the most popular girl in the year above. Shes fit and according to rumour, sexually precocious.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: The boys call Jays bluff and agree to go to the Camber Sands meeting of the Caravan Club to see if it really is like a massive orgy. Jays dad is on hand to give advice on all matters sexual, whether they want it or not.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Its the end of term and Will been voted the chairman of the Christmas prom committee. Okay, he was the only person who wanted the job, but hes still taking it seriously, and has roped Simon, Jay and Neil in to help set it up.

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: 24 year old Sian from Norfolk wants a man to drive her wild, who she can love more than her beloved car, while 33-year-old fashion entrepreneur Tansel from London is after a girl to settle down with.

programme.title: Open Range
programme.desc: Two free-grazing cattlemen, looking to live a peaceful life, find their peace is shattered and they are forced to ride for revenge when a ruthless rancher attempts to run them out of town.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Hue and Cry
programme.desc: The first of the classic `Ealing comedies in which a gang of East End youths turn the tables on the crooks who are using their favourite comic to pass coded communications.

programme.title: Monster House
programme.desc: Young DJ and his pals set out to discover what bloodcurdling secrets lie behind the front door of the scary house across the street. When the house comes alive and starts eating people, have the kids bitten off more than they can chew?

programme.title: Miracle on 34th Street
programme.desc: Kringle gets a job at Coles department store on 34th Street thanks to toy department executive Dorey Walker, who, like her daughter Susan doesnt believe in Santa Claus. However, such is Kringles success that a rival store, losing money, decides to have him declared insane for his insistence on his identity. The case comes to trial, with Doreys would-be-suitor out to prove that he really is Santa Claus.

programme.title: Evolution
programme.desc: A science professor and his cohorts battle a slew of rapidly growing alien organisms that threaten to overrun the Earth.

programme.title: Cowboys and Aliens
programme.desc: When cowboy Jake Lonergan wakes up with a strange metal device attached to his wrist, he soon finds the answers to his mystery are out of this world. A spaceship has arrived in Arizona.

programme.title: Mrs. Harris Goes to Paris
programme.desc: A cleaning lady falls madly in love with a couture Dior dress, deciding she must have one of her own. After working to raise the funds to pursue her dream, she embarks on an adventure to Paris that will change the very future of the House of Dior.

programme.title: The Invitation
programme.desc: Invited by her long-lost family to a lavish wedding in the English countryside, a woman gets thrust into a nightmare of survival as she uncovers twisted secrets and the unsettling intentions behind their sinful generosity.

programme.title: Step Brothers
programme.desc: When Nancy Huff and Robert Doback fall in love at a business conference, its not long before they are married, much to the chagrin of their spoiled sons. Brennan Huff and Dale Doback still live with their respective parents, despite being grown men, and when the inevitable happens and Nancy and Robert move in together, the two middle-aged `boys are forced to share a room.

programme.title: Barefoot in London
programme.desc: Ina Garten explores the London food scene, then conjures up meals with a British twist back home.

programme.title: Jamies Ultimate Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver has been cooking and experimenting with classic Christmas food for over two decades. This year, he pulls together his knowledge and experience to bring the very best of Christmas.

programme.title: Jamies Christmas With Bells On
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver illustrates how a little bit of preparation before the Christmas Day can leave you free to enjoy yourself. Jamie introduces some exciting new ideas, including turkey Wellington, jerky ham hock, griddle-pan waffles and epic hot chocolate, and pimped-up Prosecco.

programme.title: Jamies Christmas With Bells On
programme.desc: Jamie shows how to pull everything together for a perfect Christmas Day. The menu includes festive fiesta tacos, brussels with hustle, and a Bloody Mary seafood platter. Jamie also shows how to make the best of seasonal leftovers, with recipes such as Boxing Day turkey chowder. Plus he revisits other Christmas Day favourites, including classic roast turkey, roast potatoes and mulled wine.

programme.title: Jamies One-Pan Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver kicks off Christmas 2022 with some amazing, no-fuss dishes to get everyone in the spirit, including crispy duck, short rib beef, veggie filo pie and a decadent dessert.

programme.title: Jamies One-Pan Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie gets festive with a whole range of delicious recipes to help make Christmas dinner extra-special. Theres a salmon gravadlax starter, some gnarly new ways to do the turkey, roasties and Brussels, plus a fun new take on the Yorkshire pudding.

programme.title: Marcus Wareing At Christmas
programme.desc: Marcus Wareing gets feast-ready for Christmas with his favourite go-to recipes. He uses his world-class chef skills to create festive showstoppers.

programme.title: Marcus Wareing At Christmas
programme.desc: Marcus shares his top recipes to get in the festive mood. They include oaty pancakes with compote and the classic Bloody Mary with oysters.

programme.title: Classic Mary Berry
programme.desc: Mary Berrys Christmas Party is the perfect invitation for Yuletide escape. Some of TVs best-loved faces join Mary to cook delicious dishes, especially for her Christmas Party.

programme.title: Mary Berrys Highland Christmas
programme.desc: Mary Berry travels to her mothers homeland, Scotland, to cook a Christmas holiday feast with her friends Andy Murray, Iain Stirling and Emeli Sande.

programme.title: Mary Berrys Country House at Christmas
programme.desc: When it comes to Christmas food and entertaining, Britains country houses have always put on a show. Mary Berry visits Harewood House in Yorkshire to meet its army of skilled staff and dedicated volunteers as they prepare the house for Christmas. With its Robert Adam interiors, Chippendale furniture and Capability Brown gardens, Harewood is one of the nations most beautiful stately homes.

programme.title: Jamies Night Before Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver helps the nation raise its season game with foolproof recipes and clever last minute ways to pimp up your food. He presents his very best tips, tricks and hacks to make Christmas dinner classics taste better than ever.

programme.title: Jamies Cracking Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to wow friends and families with amazing recipes to raise your Christmas spread to the next level. In this episode he cooks roast goose with all the trimmings.

programme.title: Jamies Italian Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver puts an Italian twist on Christmas classics, and he creates a feast fit for the whole family during the Christmas holidays.

programme.title: Jamies Easy Christmas Countdown
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver offers a stress-free guide to festive feasting with his foolproof masterplan for turkey, stuffing and roast spuds, groovy veggie sides and, of course, fantastic gravy.

programme.title: Holiday Hoopla
programme.desc: Guy Fieri celebrates the holidays with dishes for Christmas and Hanukkah. Guy travels to California for a diners stuffing and to Nashville for a sugar-glazed ham.

programme.title: Cake Boss
programme.desc: Can Buddy make a life-size snowman cake for a group of pre-schoolers? Its a heart-warming reunion when Buddys former teacher stops by the bakery.

programme.title: Cake Boss
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve - the busiest day of the year at Carlos and all hands are on deck to make sure the customers get what they need in time for Christmas, be it cakes, cookies or pies.

programme.title: Cake Boss
programme.desc: A winter wonderland-themed wedding inspires Buddy to leave his comfort zone. He enlists sugar artist, Jacques Torres, to help complete the icy dream cake.

programme.title: Cake Boss
programme.sub-title: Peppermint and a Polar Bear Plunge
programme.desc: Buddy makes a cake for the Coney Island Polar Bear Club and is invited to take a winter swim with them. It is also his youngest sons birthday and he asks for an ice cream cake.

programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to wow friends and families with amazing recipes to raise your Christmas spread to the next level. In this episode he cooks roast goose with all the trimmings.

programme.title: Jamies Christmas Shortcuts
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver transforms leftovers into delicious dishes for a cosy Betwixmas, from veg tarte Tatin and sprout Caesar salad to winter veg gnocchi and panettone Black Forest trifle.

programme.title: Tom Kerridges Christmas Dinner
programme.desc: Tom shares his recipes for his favourite meal of the year - Christmas Dinner! The menu features roast turkey with all the trimmings, including pork and black pudding stuffing.

programme.title: Tom Kerridges Veggie Christmas
programme.desc: Chef Tom Kerridge shares his meat-free recipes for Christmas! The mouth-watering menu includes his puff pastry parcel, ultimate veggie gravy, and white chocolate trifle.

programme.title: Tom Kerridge Secrets of the Pub Kitchen
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge picks popular items on the menus at modern British pubs and gives them his own twist. He takes inspiration from modern gastropubs to create simple, contemporary, and delicious recipes.

programme.title: James Martins British Adventure
programme.desc: Following on from his French and American Adventures, James Martin explores the British culinary offerings.

programme.title: James Martins British Adventure
programme.desc: Following on from his French and American Adventures, James Martin explores the British culinary offerings.

programme.title: James Martins British Adventure
programme.desc: James culinary tour of Britain continues in Scotland with a trip to Blair Castle in the Highlands. He is joined by top Scottish Michelin starred chef Tom Kitchin. Their journey begins with an incredible tour of the castle grounds complete with awe inspiring views. James kicks off the cooking with his venison with beetroot and blackberries in the castles walled garden. Next Tom Kitchin dusts of his wellies and heads in to the woods for a bit of wild mushroom foraging.

programme.title: James Martins British Adventure
programme.desc: James and Tom are making their way to Edinburgh but before they can do that, James makes a detour to Edradour whisky distillery in Pitlochry where he makes a delicious whisky chicken with wild mushroom and mustard sauce. Once theyve reached Edinburgh, Tom shares his local knowledge by visiting one of his favourite suppliers, Welch Fishmongers. He learns the secret to their amazing smoked salmon which James uses for a salmon mousse with cucumber and dill pickle and melba toast.

programme.title: James Martins Great British Adventure
programme.desc: The time has come to cross the border from Scotland to England and where better to begin this leg of the journey than James home country of Yorkshire. Here hes joined by Michelin starred chef Lisa Allen. His first stop is Whitby where hes popping into his favourite fish and chip shop before cooking tikka mackerel buns with fennel and apple salad for the crowds at Whitby bandstand. Lisa is paying a visit to The Black Swan.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri road trips across America to check out classic greasy spoons. With a new generation of owners and delicious homemade food, these are the kind of places that make America special.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri hits up a brunch bonanza in Columbus, Ohio, with decadent dulce de leche pancake balls, elevated eats in Boston like rock star rum baba and punchy parmesan pasta in San Luis Obispo, California.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri checks out a unique spin on turkey tamales in Indianapolis, prime-time pan-seared chicken in Bradley Beach, New Jersey, and fully loaded lamb chops in Columbus, Ohio.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri hits the road for plant-based perfection in New Jersey, Tiffani Faisons Southern barbecue in Boston and a lamb kofta in California.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri digs Greek-style lasagna at a family-run diner in Columbus. A California joint adds flair to comfort food with top-notch chicken and dumplings. Big deal BBQ in New Jersey serves up pork and brisket piled high.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits Americas most interesting and unique restaurants.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris digging creative comfort foods, including meatloaf in Massachusetts, chicken and biscuits in Ohio and a grilled cheese in Indianapolis.

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieris grabbing big-deal eats, starting with smoking smash burgers at a whisky joint in East Boston. Then, a Minneapolis spot is serving up flavor-bursting bone marrow, and a GGG alumnus is dishing out the-bomb Bengali-American fare in Ohio.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: In Florida, Adam visits an English-style seaside eatery and an Amish restaurant.

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: In Las Vegas, can Adam manage to put away a six pound, two foot long Burrito?

programme.desc: Patrick chairs two hours of spirited debate and news making interviews. Top guests tackle the issues that matter, with a sharp take on every story.

programme.title: Patrick Christys Tonight Late Edition
programme.desc: Patrick Christys explore tomorrows news, tonight, including all the major stories making the front pages and full coverage of all the breaking news at home and abroad.

programme.title: Christmas Breakfast with Patrick
programme.desc: Joining Patrick Christys and Emily Carver as they unwrap all the festive news.

programme.title: Britains Newsroom
programme.desc: When the news happens, it happens here. But what does it mean for you? Every weekday morning, Britains Newsroom brings you the biggest stories and the answers you need from the across the UK.

programme.title: Good Afternoon Britain
programme.desc: Every weekday from midday, we bring you the news as it breaks. Wherever its happening, well have it covered - as well as giving our own view and how it matters to you with Tom and Emily.

programme.title: Martin Daubney
programme.desc: Martin gives an up-to-the-minute take on the days events delivered in his own unique and lively style.

programme.title: Dewbs and Co Christmas Special
programme.desc: Join Michelle and her panel as they debate the biggest talking points of the year and what challenges Britain faces in 2026.

programme.title: Farage Christmas Special
programme.desc: Joining Nigel and his special guests for a joyful hour-long Christmas special.

programme.title: Farage Christmas Special

programme.title: The miracle of christmas
programme.desc: Oral Roberts University presents The Miracle of Christmas, a festive concert filled with inspiring music, dazzling performances and the joy of the season.

programme.title: In touch - charles stanley

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the finest chefs from Wales are competing to be crowned champion. Two chefs are back for a second time: Phil Carmichael, from Cowbridge, South Wales, is Executive Chef at Berners Tavern in London and Adam Bannister, is chef and co-owner of Slice in his home city of Swansea. Adam was crowed Welsh champion last year so this year Phil is back with something to prove. He plans to go home raising the flag for Wales. The third chef is newcomer Andrew Birch, also from Swansea.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and newcomer Andrew Birch is confident, he is passionate about seafood. He is celebrating the cockle which is harvested near his home city of Swansea. Adam Bannister has created an alter ego, Captain Bannister for his modern take on the old boil in the bag fish dinners and Phil has chosen to revamp the classic prawn cocktail.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Phil Carmichael is serving up his version of an OBE, a refined take on onions, bacon and egg. Adam is planning to serve up Wild boar on a spit, while Andrew turns up the heat when he combines strong Japanese flavours with a traditional roast.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the dessert course and one chef will go home. Phil Carmichael is determined it wont be him but not everything is going to plan when he tackles his Cup of Tea for Maam. One of the accompaniments to his earl grey panna cotta just wont work. He has to make a difficult decision.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the head to head. The two highest scoring chefs from Wales are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort who are joined by guest judge, blogger and food writer Rosie Birkett.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three newcomers are competing to become regional champion. Daniel Smith, a former head chef for the Roux brothers, now runs his own restaurant in his beloved home county of Norfolk. Andrew Scotts worked with the best in the business, and hes concentrating on telling powerful stories as well as delivering perfect flavours. Danny Gill is a former head chef at Daniel Cliffords two star restaurant Midsummer House.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and the chefs are using some of the UKs best seafood: lobster, salmon and Cornish crab. Danny Gill is a chef who likes to use the very latest equipment to create the most intense flavours. Hes going to great lengths to maximise the taste of his cucumber consomme and it is causing a lot of interest in the kitchen.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Two chefs are cooking venison. Danny Gill is making a venison wellington, inspired by his Dad, a former RAF chef who has served up Wellington for royalty at many air force banquets. While Andrew Scott has sourced his venison from the Queens Scottish estate, Balmoral.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This week three chefs from the central region are fighting to be crowned champion. One competitor will go home, only the two highest scoring chefs will make it through to the judging chamber. Danny Gill is facing his toughest day yet, choosing to make a staggering eight elements for his imaginative dessert.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Central regions two highest scoring chefs are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort, for the very first time. Joining them in the chamber is guest judge Enam Ali MBE, a food entrepreneur who set up The British Curry Awards.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the most exciting talents from London and the South East region are competing for a place in the National Finals. Head chef Mark Froydenlund runs Marcus Wareings two star restaurant. Russell Bateman is head Chef at The Grove in Hertfordshire and Ronnie Murray who heads up the Hix Restaurant group.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and chef Russell Bateman is celebrating the diversity of his beloved home town of London - by combining lobster with jerk spices for an ambitious fish course with seven key elements. Ronnie Murrays taking a risk with an ingredient which is close to the veteran judges heart...and is planning to serve it at three different temperatures warm, deep fried and frozen. And two Michelin starred Mark Froydenlund is planning a novel way to present his dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the all-important main course and returning contender Mark Froydenlund is banking on it being his strongest dish. Russell Bateman is creating a beef dish, and Ronnie Murrays mixing a crown of lamb with a curried filling.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the dessert course and the final chance for three of London and South Easts most competitive and talented chefs to get through to the judging chamber, today the veteran judge will send one chef home.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the head to head and the two highest scoring chefs from the London and South East region are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort. Joining this week as guest judge is Kevin Gould, an award winning food writer.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Mini Patel is back for a second attempt at the north east regional title but he is competing against two young newcomers, Tommy Banks and Chris Archer. Last year, Mini went home after the dessert course, so he is hoping to keep better control of his nerves this year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and two chefs, Tommy and Mini, have very similar ingredients - both are cooking mackerel. But Mini is trying an original beetroot sorbet while Tommy is using wild woodruff and oyster leaf from his own garden. Chris Archer has chosen the king of the sea, turbot, but there is controversy in the kitchen.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the main course of the north east region and overnight there has been a dramatic development. It is a tough and emotional day for the chefs as they react to the news but they battle on in a bid to present a perfect dish with venison and wagyu-angus beef - the meat of the day.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is a highly emotional day for one of the chefs as he prepares a dish which is inspired by and a tribute to his own great Briton, his late grandfather. But all is not going to plan and the chef ends up making one key element three times in a bid to achieve perfection.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs are cooking for judges Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton for the very first time. Joining them as guest judge is John Williams MBE, the executive head chef at The Ritz, the only hotel to hold a royal warrant for banqueting.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is Chris McGowans third time however, he is facing tough competition from Mark Abbott, head chef at Daniel Cliffords 2 Michelin star restaurant, Midsummer House, and also from Eddie Attwell who has just completed a year as head chef at Ardtara Country House in Upperlands.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Mark Abbott is pushing himself again plating up a complex fish course of the very finest produce. He is calling it Shellsational but at the last minute he forgets a key element. Returning chef Chris McGowan is refining cod and chips and Eddie Attwell is getting classical with the king of the sea, turbot.The repartee is relentless as the chefs jostle for top place on the leader board. Once again there is plenty of emotion as the veteran chef delivers the scores.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the main course and returning Chef Chris McGowan is feeling confident but part of his dish involves making his own venison sausages to serve with a venison rack, and getting it all done in time is straining his emotions. Eddie Attwell is also serving the meat but with a traditional Northern Irish dish called Dock pudding. Mark Abbott is pushing himself again, he is using wagyu beef and serving it with tongue and corn cooked in a variety of ways.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three chefs from Northern Ireland are cooking their desserts and one chef is on course for a historic score, he could beat his boss - a veteran of GBM - and achieve more marks than anyone has done throughout the history of the competition.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the head to head. The two highest scoring chefs from Northern Ireland are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort who are joined by guest judge, restaurant critic and Editor-at-Large of the Independent, Amol Rajan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the national finals of `Great British Menu. Before cooking starts the eight champions are called to Londons Southbank to get a sight of the prize, the chance to cook at a banquet held at the Palace of Westminster, in celebration of everyday Great Britons honoured by the Queen. It has a huge impact on every one of the chefs, each is determined to do all he can to get a dish to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its day two of the national finals, and the eight champions cook their fish courses. This years challenge has been to produce dishes that are a lasting legacy to the New Elizabethan Age. They must showcase the transformation in British cuisine during the Queens historic 64 year reign.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is main course day, the one course every chef wants to cook at the banquet. Judging the chefs dishes are Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton and guest judge John Williams MBE, executive chef of The Ritz.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the final day of the competition, and the last chance for the eight champions to get one of their dishes to the banquet for Queen Elizabeth lls Great Britons. Judges Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton will judge the dessert course and then decide on the banquet menu to be served at the Houses of Parliament. Joining them in the judging chamber is Grace Dent, restaurant critic, journalist and author.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The winning chefs arrive at the Palace of Westminster to cook for the Banquet of Great Britons. The chefs have been selected because their dishes showcase contemporary British cuisine and demonstrate the transformation in British food during the Queens historic reign.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their summery starters. A dish celebrating childhood summer memories takes on a complicated courgette dish and a technically tricky take on the cucumber sandwich.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more intense as all the chefs take risks with their dishes. Mike Reid, Executive Chef at M Restaurants in London, shocks with when he pairs his fish with some highly unusual flavours.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its a smoke filled kitchen as the three chefs prepare their summer themed mains in the hope of impressing the veteran judge. Selin Kiazim is in her element, cooking a feast inspired by the summer barbecues she enjoyed with her family.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are feeling the pressure as they attempt their technical summer desserts. With only the two highest scorers going through to tomorrows regional final, who will be sent home?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and the South East chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. Theyre hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges: nd for the first time this year, broadcaster and restaurateur Andi Oliver.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs have been challenged to create outstanding dishes that capture a `taste of summer. Their menus must reflect the tastes, smells and colours of everybodys favourite time of year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the fish course and with a seafood specialist in the kitchen the competition is stepping up a gear. Tom is hoping hell be able to elevate the humble mackerel to the standards required for the Wimbledon banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are honouring Wimbledon and the British summer with their technically challenging strawberry desserts. Only the two highest scorers will go through to cook for the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are honouring Wimbledon and the British summer with their technically challenging strawberry desserts. Only the two highest scorers will go through to cook for the judges.

programme.title: Ice Age: Continental Drift
programme.desc: Scrats continuous pursuit of an infernal acorn has world-changing consequences for Manny, Sid and Diego when the continents split apart. The continental crackup separates Manny and his friends from the rest of the herd, including Mannys mate, Ellie, and rebellious daughter, Peaches. The pals are desperate to return home, but a pirate and his ragtag crew stand in their way.

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.sub-title: For Whom the Sleigh Bell Tolls
programme.desc: Stan gives Steve a gun for Christmas even though Francine warns him that Steve is too young. As usual, Stan ignores her and when Steve accidentally shoots Santa, he sends the North Pole into a tizzy and jeopardises Christmas.

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Father Donovan holds a Christmas play at the mall and casts Stan as Santa Claus and Roger as Jesus, but after the two get in a fight and cause a scene, Stan is kicked out of the church.

programme.title: Bobs Burgers
programme.desc: After Gene breaks his favourite, extremely rare 70s era Christmas record, Tina and Louise join him in the search for another copy; Teddy wants to do a neighbourhood Secret Santa with Bob and Linda.

programme.title: Bobs Burgers
programme.desc: Bob and Linda try to attend all three kids holiday performances at the same time.

programme.title: Bobs Burgers
programme.desc: When the power goes out two days before Christmas, The Belchers must spend the holiday at Mr. Fischoeders familys old hunting lodge.

programme.title: The Stand Up Sketch Show
programme.desc: The Stand Up Sketch Show is back with a festive Christmas Special. The show features some of the nations top comedians performing their finest stand-up comedy routines on stage, which are then hilariously brought to life in sketch form. This year Russell Kane, Seann Walsh, Dane Baptiste, Glenn Moore, Lily Phillips, Nabil Abdul Rashid, Bella Hull and Vidura Rajapaksa take to the stage.

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A rape case appears to be solved when the chief suspect is murdered. However, nothing is what it seems, and soon Lewis and Hathaway find the upper echelons of Oxford society closing ranks.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna, Sally, and Beth decide to go on strike and let the men deal with Christmas, with disastrous results. Meanwhile, a teenage daughter returns home and reveals she is pregnant, Beth meets an unusual patient, Anna and David share a moment, and Sam campaigns for a white Christmas.

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: A daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Good will to all men - not for Simon and Oliver. A Christmas special from 1989.

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Jack takes a fancy to Arthurs sister, much to Arthurs chagrin.

programme.title: Clash of the Santas
programme.desc: Following the adventures of bickering best friends Colin and Howie from the `City Lights series. The two fighting friends travel to Lithuania to take part in the World Santa Championships, where Howie will represent England. Colin is not too impressed at his own job: Howies Elf helper. The pals end up going head to head when Colin is recruited by the mysterious Rainbow Santa team, but is the team all it seems?

programme.title: Mr Bean
programme.desc: Mr Bean goes Christmas shopping, conducts a Salvation Army band, and has Christmas dinner with his long-suffering girlfriend.

programme.title: Steptoe and Son Ride Again
programme.desc: Things are bad at the Steptoes Shepherds Bush rag-and-bone business - so bad, in fact, that Harold is convinced that Albert must die so he can collect the old mans life insurance.

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Theft of the Royal Ruby
programme.desc: Poirot prepares to spend a quiet Christmas on his own with a box of chocolates, but he has to give up his plans when the British government asks for his urgent help. Prince Farouk, a young member of the Egyptian royal family visiting London, has lost a famous ruby, and this is deemed to be a matter of national security.

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: A snow blizzard sets in and Miss Marple is forced to take refuge at Sittaford House, isolated on a bleak Devon moor. The owner of the house, Captain Trevelyan, inexplicably decides to spend the night at a local hotel where a ouija board predicts his death. He is later found dead in his room - and Miss Marples suspicions are confirmed.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It may be Christmas but Charlie is given no time to familiarise himself with his new surroundings. He finds himself thrown straight into an intriguing mystery in the village of Morton Shallows, as furniture maker and serial philanderer Conor Bridgeman is stabbed to death with an antique sword during a ghost-hunting party at the manor house.

programme.title: A Christmas Carol
programme.desc: This Dickens classic comes around again.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Portwenn is full of festive cheer - until Doc Martin cancels the Santa, prompting his portrayer to show Doc the Grinch the magic of Christmas, with unintended consequences.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Vera investigates the death of suspected poacher Shane Thurgood.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Its Christmas and the troubled Villiers family get together nine years after the death of eldest son Ferdy, a magician. A riddle in a cracker predicts that two people will die before midnight on Boxing Day, then the frail Lydia Villiers is hospitalised after a fall. As Barnaby abandons his Christmas lunch with the in-laws to investigate, it seems as though ghosts from the past are haunting the household.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When a man is found dead with wedding rings lodged in his mouth, Geordie is horrified - it has all the hallmarks of an old unsolved murder.

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The return of the detective drama. Lewis and Hathaway investigate the strange murder of a beautiful young Eastern European woman whose death comes straight from the pages of a popular fantasy novel written by Oxford tutor Dorian Crane. Is this the work of a crazed fan, or is there something even more sinister going on? Soon it becomes evident that those close to Crane are in danger.

programme.title: British Touring Car Championship
programme.desc: Louise Goodman reviews the 2025 Kwik Fit British Touring Car Championship season and has an exclusive interview with Tom Ingram, who was crowned champion for the second time after defeating long-time rival Ash Sutton after a season that saw championship momentum swing both ways between the drivers before being sealed on the final weekend of the season - new regulations led to unpredictable action and a grand total of 13 different race winners throughout a season full of door-to-door action.
